newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian shipper gets DM25 mln Creditanstalt loan.
newsitem.headline: Croatian shipper gets DM25 mln Creditanstalt loan.

text.p: Croatian state-owned shipper Jadrolinija got a 25 milllion German marks loan from Austria's Credianstalt Bankverein, daily newspaper Vjesnik reported on Friday.
It said the funds would be used to renew Jadrolinija's fleet but no company officials were available for comment.
The loan was said to have been granted for seven years at 4.6 percent interest with the Croatian government guarantees, Vjesnik said.

Jadrolinija would use 10.5 million marks to refinance part of the purchase of the new vessel Dubrovnik and the rest would go toward building three new ferries in Kraljevica and Split shipyards, the newspaper said.
The agreement was signed in port town of Rijeka Thursday.
